title: Authors and Citation
text: Wild M (2023). europopgridviewer: Shiny app view eurostat population grids. R package version 0.1.1, https://michael-cw.github.io/europopgridviewer/.
code: @Manual{,   title = {europopgridviewer: Shiny app to view eurostat population grids},   author = {Michael Wild},   year = {2023},   note = {R package version 0.1.1},   url = {https://michael-cw.github.io/europopgridviewer/}, }

what: Shiny app to view eurostat population grids
title: Shiny app to view eurostat population grids
text: package europopgridviewer simple shiny application build help golem package allows load Eurostat population grids R mapdeck based map viewer. currently allows download 10km 5km grid, mainly due processing requirements granular resolutions. fetch data, uses giscoR package.

title: Shiny app to view eurostat population grids
text: Install R: https://cran.r-project.org/mirrors.html (version 4.1.1 greater) Install R Studio: https://rstudio.com/products/rstudio/download/ (version 1.2.5001-3 newer) Make sure devtools package installed, install : install actual package:

title: Shiny app to view eurostat population grids
text: Start R Studio run following commands: load default map members European Statistical System.  selected country well desired grid layer (5km 10km) two drop inputs sidebar, application load grid onto map.  case want use map external file, like .e. presentation report, can also download map clicking Download PDF.  using map externally make sure, also use giscoR package attribution, shown Info tab.

title: Shiny app to view eurostat population grids
text: learn individual run time parameters, please run following commands: give information required. important one mapbox key base map. case using mapbox key, application still work, however display layer without background map.

title: Pipe operator — %>%
text: lhs value magrittr placeholder. rhs function call using magrittr semantics.

title: Run the Shiny Application — run_app
text: start population grid viewer. details population grid copyright correct attribution, retrieved giscoR package, please click info tab.

title: Run the Shiny Application — run_app
code: run_app(   mapboxkey = NULL,   onStart = NULL,   options = list(),   enableBookmarking = NULL,   uiPattern = "/",   ... )

title: Run the Shiny Application — run_app
text: mapboxkey mapbox key required basemap. key provided, different layers still visible, without background map. onStart function called app actually run. needed shinyAppObj, since shinyAppDir case, global.R file can used purpose. options Named options passed runApp call (can following: "port", "launch.browser", "host", "quiet", "display.mode" "test.mode"). can also specify width height parameters provide hint embedding environment ideal height/width app. enableBookmarking Can one "url", "server", "disable". default value, NULL, respect setting previous calls  enableBookmarking(). See enableBookmarking() information bookmarking app. uiPattern regular expression applied GET request determine whether ui used handle request. Note entire request path must match regular expression order match considered successful. ... arguments pass golem_opts. See `?golem::get_golem_options` details.
